diseaseDescription: Caused by Acidovorax (formerly Pseudomonas) cattleyae, it produces soft, water-soaked blisters that become brown or black, often oozing bacterial fluid, especially in humid, warm conditions.

culturalCare.title: Humidity & Water Management
steps: Reduce humidity and stop overhead watering
Keep leaves dry and avoid wet crowns

culturalCare.title: Remove Infected Tissue
steps: Cut away blotches with sterile tools

chemicalControl.title: Bactericide Sprays
steps: Apply Physan 20 (quaternary ammonium) or copper compounds
Treat both infected and adjacent plants following label

ecoFriendly.title: Hydrogen Peroxide
steps: Use dilute H₂O₂ on cleaned surfaces
Helps sanitize and prevent further spread
